event.title: hosts the Lilac Festival in May

data.event: Mission contains the very popular 4th Street with many trendy restaurants and shops, and it hosts the Lilac Festival in May.
After a temporary location 40 km (25 mi) away (started in 1872), Oblate missionary Father Constantine Scollen, on behalf of the Roman Catholic Church, founded the permanent location in 1875.
After a temporary location 40 km (25 mi) away (started in 1872), Oblate missionary Father Constantine Scollen, on behalf of the Roman Catholic Church, founded the permanent location in 1875.

In 1883, Oblate missionary Father Albert Lacombe, returning after a ten-year absence, obtained two quarter sections of land for a "Mission district" to ensure a strong French speaking Catholic community.

event.title: now Mission, the area was incorporated

data.event: After obtaining the rest of the land that's now Mission, the area was incorporated on November 2, 1899 as the Village of Rouleauville named after Charles Rouleau.

event.title: November 2, 1899 as the Village of Rouleauville named

data.event: After obtaining the rest of the land that's now Mission, the area was incorporated on November 2, 1899 as the Village of Rouleauville named after Charles Rouleau.
In 1907 the village was annexed by Calgary.
